intro: Weberbauera trichocarpa, commonly known as the hairy leaf bauera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
